result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Cristian Sanchez was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Cristian Sanchez was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program ONLY After serving 12 months of initial confinement. Sentence credit of 112 days were granted.
8/3/22 COURT AMENDS SENTENCE CREDIT TO 111 DAYS.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Only exception is that the defendant may work in an establishment that serves alcohol.

Inform agent of all prescriptions. Mantain full time employment (35hrs/wk) Defendant to obtain full time employment within the first 60 days or Extended Supervision. Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid drivers license. 
Cases 22TR1219, 22TR1221, 22TR1222, 22TR1223 & 22TR1224 were dismissed and read in.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision may be transferred to the State of Illinois.
Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on Count 1.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Wisconsin State Patrol. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on Count 1.

Straight time. Consecutive to Count 1.
Consecutive to: Count 1
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Cristian Sanchez in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court addresses amended complaint filed in 22CF313 on 5/11/22.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended complaint and waives further reading.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 is dismissed and read in.  Count 4 is dismissed by operation of law.  Cases 22TR1219, 22TR1221, 22TR1222, 22TR1223 and 22TR1224 are dismissed and read in to this matter.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
3 Years 6 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 112 Days)
-	18 Months of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision.  Extended Supervision may be transferred to Illinois.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 months of initial confinement.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia with the exeption that the defendant may work in an establishment that serves alcohol;
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week).  Defendant to obtain full time employment within the first 60 days of Extended Supervision;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Drivers License;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


Count 2:
160 Days Jail CONSECUTIVE to Count 1

DL REVOCATION:  18 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 18 months.

FINE:  $ 1368.00

IID Surcharge: $50.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 25.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Wisconsin State Patrol.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

AODA Assessment and follow through
Lab Report, filed by District Attorney
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:53 AM Defendant Cristian Sanchez in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is looking for a global resolution and requests a plea and sentencing date.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:39 AM Defendant Cristian Sanchez in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State Patrol, Trooper, Keegan Williams sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Brejcha.  Cross examination by Atty. Miller.  State rests.  Atty. Brejcha moves for bind over.  Atty. Miller moves for bind over.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
